summary: Public Safety: Meet Us Before You Need Us
locationaddress: College Walk, Columbia University, 116th St. Between Broadway & Amsterdam, New York, NY 10027
description: <p>Public Safety is excited to welcome students back to campus! On Wednesday, September 7,&nbsp; students will have the opportunity to meet Public Safety team members at the College Walk Sundial&nbsp;&nbsp;to learn more about who we are, learn about safety resources available and ways to stay connected with Public Safety. Sweet treats prepared by Columbia Dining will also be available &ndash; don&rsquo;t miss out!</p>

summary: The Global Roadmap for Health Longevity
locationaddress: Online Event
categories: International and Public Affairs,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Seminar,Online,Law,Family-friendly,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Basic Health Sciences,Earth Institute,Social Sciences,Social Justice,School of Social Work,Research,Postdocs,Global Programs,org/cac,Prospective Students,Healthcare,Graduate Students,College of Dental Medicine,College of Physicians and Surgeons,Mailman School of Public Health,Trainees,org/cumc
description: <p>A Columbia Aging Center Seminar featuring speakers: John Beard, MBBS, PhD, Professor, University of New South Wales; Linda P. Fried, MD, MPH, Dean and DeLamar Professor, Columbia Mailman School of Public Health, Director, Robert N. Butler Columbia Aging Center; and John W. Rowe, MD, Julius Richmond Professor of Health Policy and Aging, Columbia Mailman Department of Health Policy and Management and Robert N. Butler Columbia Aging Center.</p>\n<p>Recognizing the need to take action in the face of demographic change created by increased longevity, the National Academy of Medicine formed an international commission of experts to develop an evidence-based plan to advance healthy longevity and its societal opportunities around the globe. The result is the recently released National Academy of Medicine Global Roadmap for Healthy Longevity. To download the report, visit <a href="https://nap.nationalacademies.org/catalog/26144/global-roadmap-for-healthy-longevity" target="_blank">https://nap.nationalacademies.org/catalog/26144/global-roadmap-for-healthy-longevity</a>.&nbsp;<br />\nOur September 8, 2022, seminar will envision the future-back solutions and introduce coming seminars on the a whole of society approach to healthy aging integrating: the assets of older age, social infrastructure, health systems, health equity and reduction of disparities, the physical environment and more.&nbsp; &nbsp;Register here: <a href="https://tinyurl.com/CACRoadmap" target="_blank">https://tinyurl.com/CACRoadmap</a></p>

summary: Getting Your Bearings: Humanities and History
locationaddress: Online Event
description: <p>This workshop will help users feel right at home in the Columbia University Libraries. Learn to navigate the library system and find your way around. Explore new ways to discover and access: books, articles, videos, sound files, images, ebooks, and more, on-site or at home. This event is open to current students, faculty, and staff. Register by one hour prior to the start of workshop to reserve your spot and receive the Zoom link.</p>

summary: Yoga Class
locationaddress: Earl Hall, 2980 Broadway, New York, NY 10027
description: <p>Take a break to relax and refresh with yoga in Earl Hall. Free Yoga classes (open level) will be offered in the Auditorium in Earl Hall every&nbsp;Thursday evening&nbsp;during the fall 2022 semester.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>No pre-registration required;&nbsp;open to all Columbia University students. Please bring your own mat and arrive 5-10 minutes early to sign in and set up.&nbsp;There is a 5 minute late policy, doors close at 7:05pm.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This event is part of Welcome&nbsp;Home Columbia Fall 2022. Welcome Home Columbia events are free and open to all students, from all schools, on all campuses. See a full list of&nbsp;<a href="https://universitylife.columbia.edu/welcome" target="_blank">Welcome Home Columbia events</a>.</p>

summary: Welcome Back Week 2022: Activities Day
locationaddress: Low Plaza, 535 W. 116 St., New York, NY 10027
categories: Morningside,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Information Session,Student,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,org/ColumbiaCollege,Columbia College,Columbia Engineering,Countdown to Columbia,Community,org/UndergradStudentLife,Undergraduate Student Life,Other
description: <p>Are you feeling like this might be your time to shine? Columbia Activities Day offers a great opportunity to find your niche and begin to carve out your place at Columbia.</p>\n<p>Welcome back to campus life! Join Undergraduate Student Life, and other advising units, at Activities Day, taking place on Low Plaza and Lower Campus.&nbsp;Grab a friend or roommate and check out over 300 student-run organizations, including identity groups, religious life, performance groups, fraternity and sorority life, club sports, and service groups, amongst others. Student leaders from each recognized group will be available for questions.</p>

summary: Workshop: World Development Report 2023 on Cross-border Mobility
locationaddress: International Affairs Building, 420 W. 118 St., New York, NY 10027
description: <p>The World Bank&rsquo;s World Development Report is an invaluable guide to the economic, social, and environmental state of the world today. Each report provides in-depth analysis and policy recommendations on a specific and important aspect of development&mdash;from agriculture, the role of the state, transition economies, and labor to infrastructure, health, the environment, and poverty.</p>\n<p>With this workshop, Columbia SIPA&rsquo;s Center on Global Economic Governance, Cornell University and the World Bank&nbsp;will convene the Report authors, alongside&nbsp;faculty and scholars, for a discussion of the &quot;World Development Report 2023: Cross-border mobility in a globalizing world&quot;.</p>\n<p>Registration is required and space is limited. This event is open only to current SIPA&nbsp;students. To register, please email cgeg@columba.edu.&nbsp;</p>

summary: Wake Forest University, NC - In-Person Nursing Information Event
locationaddress: Off-campus
categories: org/NursingAdmissions,Off Campus,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Conference,Course,Open House,Information Session,Family-friendly,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Basic Health Sciences,Clinical Health Sciences,Panel,Continuing Education,Research,Postdocs,Careers,Admissions,Advising,Prospective Students,Professional Development,Healthcare,Discussion,Graduate Students,Wellness,Columbia Nursing,Trainees,Community,Education,Natural Sciences,Training
description: <p>Nursing has fast become a great career path based on the patient advocacy, clinical acumen and research options. &nbsp;In our joint sessions, we partner with the nursing schools from the University of Pennsylvania and Johns Hopkins University to discuss nursing on a broader scale and how our programs address the various pathways to and through the field. By attending this session, you will not only participate in the discussion, but have the opportunity to gain a better understanding of program options and have your questions answered.</p>\n<p>Please register via the link below:</p>\n<p><a href="https://admissions.nursing.columbia.edu/register/?id=b493934b-4940-4869-9acf-7ed3c1a617bf" target="_blank">Register Here!</a></p>

summary: Davidson College, NC - In-Person Nursing Information Event
locationaddress: Off-campus
categories: org/NursingAdmissions,Off Campus,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Conference,Course,Open House,Information Session,Family-friendly,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Basic Health Sciences,Clinical Health Sciences,Panel,Continuing Education,Research,Postdocs,Careers,Admissions,Advising,Prospective Students,Professional Development,Healthcare,Discussion,Graduate Students,Wellness,Columbia Nursing,Trainees,Community,Education,Natural Sciences,Training
description: <p>Nursing has fast become a great career path based on the patient advocacy, clinical acumen and research options. &nbsp;In our joint sessions, we partner with the nursing schools from the University of Pennsylvania and Johns Hopkins University to discuss nursing on a broader scale and how our programs address the various pathways to and through the field. By attending this session, you will not only participate in the discussion, but have the opportunity to gain a better understanding of program options and have your questions answered.</p>\n<p>Please register via the link below:</p>\n<p><a href="https://admissions.nursing.columbia.edu/register/?id=80057f76-fa09-41e8-b23b-cb8f5051ad15" target="_blank">Register Here!</a></p>

summary: Columbia Center on Sustainable Investment (CCSI) “Meet and Greet”
locationaddress: Jerome Greene Hall, 435 W. 116 St., New York, NY 10027
description: <p>The <a href="https://ccsi.columbia.edu/" target="_blank">Columbia Center on Sustainable Investment</a>&nbsp;will&nbsp;be hosting a&nbsp;&ldquo;Meet&nbsp;and&nbsp;Greet&rdquo;&nbsp;for interested students to&nbsp;meet&nbsp;the staff of CCSI&nbsp;and&nbsp;learn more about our work&nbsp;and&nbsp;activities&nbsp;and&nbsp;how students can get involved.</p>\n<p>Please join us&nbsp;on&nbsp;September 13, 2022, 8:30-9:30am,&nbsp;in Case Lounge, 7th fl, Jerome Greene Hall. We look forward to seeing many of you there!</p>

summary: ISSO Newly Arrived J-1 Faculty and Researchers Orientation
locationaddress: Online Event
description: <p>This ISSO sponsored event is for Newly Arrived J-1 Faculty and Researchers at Columbia University.<br />\n<br />\nYou are invited to our Newly Arrived J-1 Faculty and Researchers Orientation. These sessions are for those who have recently arrived. The orientation covers an overview of this visa status. ISSO strongly recommends you attend. Please have your DS-2019 and passport available. <a href="https://columbiauniversity.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_dmPVsF4dSLuO-H2yKp8aAg" target="_blank">Register here</a>.</p>

summary: Public Safety: Meet Us Before You Need Us
locationaddress: Lerner Hall, 2920 Broadway, New York, NY 10027
description: <p>Public Safety is excited to welcome students back to campus! On Tuesday September 13th,&nbsp;students will have the opportunity to meet Public Safety team members at the South Field area&nbsp;between Lerner Hall and Butler Library&nbsp;to learn more about who we are, learn about safety resources available and ways to stay connected with Public Safety. Sweet treats prepared by Columbia Dining will also be available &ndash; don&rsquo;t miss out!</p>

summary: Getting Your Bearings: Humanities and History
locationaddress: Online Event
description: <p>This workshop will help users feel right at home in the Columbia University Libraries. Learn to navigate the library system and find your way around. Explore new ways to discover and access: books, articles, videos, sound files, images, ebooks, and more, on-site or at home. This event is open to current students, faculty, and staff. Register by 11am on the day of the workshop to reserve your spot and receive the Zoom link.</p>

summary: Virtual Naloxone Training (Open to all Columbia community members)
locationaddress: Online
description: <p>Columbia Health is a Registered Opioid Overdose Prevention Program, recognized by New York City and State Departments of Health. This designation came as part of a collaboration with researchers from the Mailman School of Public Health and the School of General Studies. As part of this work, Columbia Health is offering virtual Naloxone training via Zoom to members of the Columbia University community. Naloxone kits&nbsp;can be picked up from Columbia Health or mailed to participants upon completion of training.&nbsp;If you would like to learn more about the training, please visit&nbsp;<a href="https://health.columbia.edu/content/naloxone-training">https://health.columbia.edu/content/naloxone-training</a>.</p>\n<p>Registration required.</p>\n<p><strong>Register for the September&nbsp;14, 2:00&nbsp;- 3:00 PM ET&nbsp;session:&nbsp;</strong><a href="https://nam02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fbit.ly%2F3R76T0e&amp;data=05%7C01%7Chealthcomm%40cumc.columbia.edu%7C50a33932bb2c481025d008da852efeaa%7Cb0002a9b0017404d97dc3d3bab09be81%7C1%7C0%7C637968734122978641%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&amp;sdata=bcna%2B4bVCQvvLaGp1qNhFuCTZpfSE3%2BE4BOQDlSe4qw%3D&amp;reserved=0">https://bit.ly/3R76T0e</a></p>

summary: Geochemistry Seminar
locationaddress: Gary C. Comer Geochemistry Building, 61 Route 9W, Palisades, NY 10964
categories: org/CCS,org/geochem,Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Seminar,Family-friendly,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Earth Institute,Postdocs,Prospective Students,Graduate Students,Trainees,org/EI,org/LDEO
description: <p>The Geochemistry seminars for Fall 2022 will be held both in person and virtually on <strong>Wednesdays at 2 pm (EST)</strong>. In-person talks will be held in the <strong>Comer first floor seminar room</strong> at Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory.</p>\n<p>Speaker schedule TBA.</p>\n<p>If you have any questions, commments, or suggestions, please contact the seminar coordinators.</p>

description: <p>This ISSO sponsored event is for Newly Arrived J-1 Faculty and Researchers at Columbia University.</p>\n<p>These sessions are for those who have recently arrived. : las2336 for PublicHealth (agrp_PublicHealth),X-BEDEWORK-ADDITIONAL-INFO : values : text : Grand Rounds was initiated in 2008 at the Columbia Mailman School of Public Health to create an intellectual space within which to explore national and global public health challenges and the innovative approaches needed to transform the public’s health in the 21st century. 

All events will be hybrid and open to the public. All in-person participants are required to have their primary series and one booster dose of COVID-19 vaccines. Visitors should be prepared to show proof of vaccination while on campus.

categories: Morningside,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Information Session,Student,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Columbia College,Columbia Engineering,First-years,Sophomores,Juniors,Seniors,First-Generation Students,Transfer Students,Global Core,Global Programs,General Studies,org/OGPF,LGBTQ,Study Abroad,Barnard College
description: Join UGE and program representatives from College Year in Athens (CYA) as we discuss this incredible program opportunity! Take your learning beyond the classroom and gain hands-on experiences in the abundant environment of Greece. The curriculum spans a wide range of disciplines from ancient to contemporary studies and focuses on the history and civilization of Greece and the East Mediterranean region. \nJoin us to learn more!

summary: New Frontiers in Cancer Research and Care: The Next 50 Years
locationaddress: Roy And Diana Vagelos Education Center, 104 Haven Ave., New York, NY 10032
categories: org/Neurology,org/seas_compsci,org/IICD,Medical Center,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Family-friendly,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Clinical Health Sciences,Postdocs,org/pediatrics,Prospective Students,Graduate Students,Symposium,College of Dental Medicine,College of Physicians and Surgeons,Mailman School of Public Health,Trainees,org/cumc_hiccc,org/CUMCGovComAff,org/cumc
description: <p>Join the Herbert Irving Comprehensive Cancer Center (HICCC) on September 15&nbsp;for a special symposium in recognition of our 50th anniversary of NCI designation. This symposium will feature keynote addresses from&nbsp;Margaret Foti, PhD, MD (hc),&nbsp;Chief Executive Officer of the American Association for Cancer Research and&nbsp;Ned Sharpless, MD,&nbsp;former Director of the National Cancer Institute, along with remarks from present and past directors of the HICCC and a series of talks from leading HICCC members about the future of cancer research and care at Columbia.</p>\n<p><em>Please join us for the symposium and a reception following.</em></p>

summary: Monthly overview of IRI's Global Seasonal Climate Forecasts and ENSO status and forecast.
locationaddress: Online
description: The International Research Institute for Climate and Society (IRI) presents its climate forecast briefing. The IRI's seasonal, sub-seasonal and ENSO (El Niño Southern Oscillation) forecasts are discussed in this monthly briefing by IRI climate scientists Azhar Ehsan and Bohar Singh.\nFor more information, please see: https://iri.columbia.edu/our-expertise/climate/

summary: Yoga Class
locationaddress: Earl Hall, 2980 Broadway, New York, NY 10027
description: <p>Take a break to relax and refresh with yoga in Earl Hall. Free Yoga classes (open level) will be offered in the Auditorium in Earl Hall every&nbsp;Thursday evening&nbsp;during the fall 2022 semester.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>No pre-registration required;&nbsp;open to all Columbia University students. Please bring your own mat and arrive 5-10 minutes early to sign in and set up.&nbsp;There is a 5 minute late policy, doors close at 7:05pm.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This event is part of Welcome&nbsp;Home Columbia Fall 2022. Welcome Home Columbia events are free and open to all students, from all schools, on all campuses. See a full list of&nbsp;<a href="https://universitylife.columbia.edu/welcome" target="_blank">Welcome Home Columbia events</a>.</p>

summary: ISSO F-1 Post-Completion Optional Practical Training (OPT) Workshop
locationaddress: Online Event
description: <p>In this ISSO sponsored session, an ISSO advisor will discuss eligibility requirements and application procedures for F-1 Optional Practical Training (OPT) employment authorization after your graduation. OPT is a benefit and extension of F-1 student status that allows you to work in your field of study for up to 12 months and is authorized by USCIS, the immigration agency. Learn more about Post-Completion OPT -- <a href="http://bit.ly/optemployment" target="_blank">http://bit.ly/optemployment</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><a href="https://columbiauniversity.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_vDBzQNBvRVmvQoisTflNAA" target="_blank">RSVP HERE</a></p>

summary: Virtual Communications Lab: Fall 2022 Communications Overview
locationaddress: Online Event
description: <p>WeConnect&rsquo;s Virtual Communications Lab continues with a series of workshops to address decisions and functions shared among Columbia&#39;s schools, departments, centers, institutes, and business units.</p>\n<p><strong>Shailagh Murray</strong>, Executive Vice President of Public Affairs and <strong>Ben Chang</strong>, Vice President for Communications, will kick off the series with a one-hour Zoom session with a Fall 2022 Communications Overview. Join to learn about University priorities, strategies and plans to help start your semester.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Please register for reminders and zoom link.</p>

summary: Columbia 101: Get to Know Columbia Health
locationaddress: John Jay Hall, 519 W. 114 St., New York, NY 10027
description: Join us for our first Columbia 101 program of the year with Columbia Health! Whether it's a conversation about substance abuse, how you can get better sleep, or how you can focus on your well-being, Alice! has you covered! Through one-on-one conversations, workshops, and student leader trainings, Alice! Health Promotion prioritizes well-being to create communities where students can be happy, healthy, and well at Columbia and beyond. \nColumbia 101 is a biweekly program series designed for first year undergraduate students in Columbia College and the School of Engineering and Applied Sciences to learn about a variety of resources available at Columbia. The Residential Life Staff within the First Year Area will partner with a variety of departments across campus and bring them into the residence halls to host discussion based workshops.\nRegistration is strongly encouraged!

summary: Baltimore, MD - In-Person Nursing Information Event
locationaddress: Off-campus
categories: org/NursingAdmissions,Off Campus,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Conference,Course,Open House,Information Session,Family-friendly,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Basic Health Sciences,Clinical Health Sciences,Panel,Continuing Education,Research,Postdocs,Careers,Admissions,Advising,Prospective Students,Professional Development,Healthcare,Discussion,Graduate Students,Wellness,Columbia Nursing,Trainees,Community,Education,Natural Sciences,Training
description: <p>Nursing has fast become a great career path based on the patient advocacy, clinical acumen and research options. &nbsp;In our joint sessions, we partner with the nursing schools from the University of Pennsylvania and Johns Hopkins University to discuss nursing on a broader scale and how our programs address the various pathways to and through the field. By attending this session, you will not only participate in the discussion, but have the opportunity to gain a better understanding of program options and have your questions answered.</p>\n<p>Please register via the link below:</p>\n<p><a href="https://admissions.nursing.columbia.edu/register/?id=ecad2a68-7f99-43ff-8b81-c64794d2deec" target="_blank">Register Here!</a></p>

summary: DIS: Study Abroad in Scandinavia Info Session
locationaddress: Kent Hall, 1140 Amsterdam Ave., New York, NY 10027
categories: Morningside,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Information Session,Student,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Columbia College,Columbia Engineering,First-years,Juniors,Seniors,First-Generation Students,Global Programs,General Studies,org/gs,org/OGPF,LGBTQ,Study Abroad,Barnard College
description: Join UGE and program representatives from DIS: Study Abroad in Scandinavia as we discuss DIS Copenhagen and DIS Stockholm opportunities! Participate in an academically challenging semester abroad program with over 240 courses across disciplines like engineering, gender sexuality studies, neuroscience, sustainability, and architecture. Discover Europe through Study Tours that bring course topics to life while pursuing your academic and personal goals.\nJoin us to learn more!

summary: Employment Challenges Amidst Premature Deindustrialization
locationaddress: International Affairs Building, 420 W. 118 St., New York, NY 10027
categories: International and Public Affairs,Morningside,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Lecture,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,org/sipa,Postdocs,Prospective Students,org/SIPA_EPD,Graduate Students,Trainees,org/SIPA_CDEP
description: <p>Join a seminar on <strong>Employment Challenges Amidst Premature Deindustrialization: An African Profile</strong> presented by <a href="http://www.dpru.uct.ac.za/professor-haroon-bhorat-director-dpru-school-economics-uct" target="_blank">Haroon Bhorat</a>,&nbsp;Director of the Development Policy Research Unit at the University of Cape Town.&nbsp;This event will be moderated by Akbar Noman, SIPA Adjunct Professor and Senior Fellow, Initiative for Policy Dialogue.&nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>This event will be held in person (for CUID holders) and online (non-CUID holders). Registration is required to receive a Zoom link.&nbsp;</strong>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>This event is sponsored by the <a href="https://www.sipa.columbia.edu/academics/concentrations/economic-and-political-development" target="_blank">Economic and Political Development Concentration</a>, the <a href="https://cdep.sipa.columbia.edu/" target="_blank">Center for Development Economics and Policy</a>,&nbsp;SIPA Pan African Network (SPAN) and the <a href="https://www.ias.columbia.edu/" target="_blank">Institute of African Studies</a>.&nbsp;</p>

description: Drop in during open advising hours if you are interested in learning more about DIS Copenhagen and DIS Stockholm study abroad opportunities! Program representatives from DIS: Study Abroad in Scandinavia will be able to discuss with you the semester abroad program options with over 240 courses across disciplines like economics, political science, neuroscience, sustainability, and literature. summary: Washington D.C. - In-Person Nursing Information Event
locationaddress: Off-campus
categories: org/NursingAdmissions,Off Campus,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Conference,Course,Open House,Information Session,Family-friendly,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Basic Health Sciences,Clinical Health Sciences,Panel,Continuing Education,Research,Postdocs,Careers,Admissions,Advising,Prospective Students,Professional Development,Healthcare,Discussion,Graduate Students,Wellness,Columbia Nursing,Trainees,Community,Education,Natural Sciences,Training
description: <p>Nursing has fast become a great career path based on the patient advocacy, clinical acumen and research options. &nbsp;In our joint sessions, we partner with the nursing schools from the University of Pennsylvania and Johns Hopkins University to discuss nursing on a broader scale and how our programs address the various pathways to and through the field. By attending this session, you will not only participate in the discussion, but have the opportunity to gain a better understanding of program options and have your questions answered.</p>\n<p>Please register via the link below:</p>\n<p><a href="https://admissions.nursing.columbia.edu/register/?id=58c92bbb-86ed-4bd6-99af-4e6fe9bf42d5" target="_blank">Register Here!</a></p>

summary: M.S in Sustainability Management Online Information Session
locationaddress: Online Event
description: <h3><a href="https://apply.sps.columbia.edu/register/?id=9a7b26d1-ed2f-4e12-ae48-b6f38963210d" target="_blank"><strong>Please&nbsp;RSVP&nbsp;here</strong></a></h3>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p>Please join us for an online information session on the <a href="https://www.sustainability.ei.columbia.edu/" target="_blank">MS in Sustainability Managemen</a>t program, offered jointly by Columbia Climate School&#39;s&nbsp;Earth Institute and School of Professional Studies&nbsp;at Columbia University.&nbsp;his program is designed for those who wish to pursue a career in management that takes into account both the environment and the economy. Graduates transform how organizations do business by formulating and implementing sustainability strategies. The coursework combines the study of management with classes in state-of-the-art sustainability practice and science, with full-time and part-time options for those with current professional obligations.</p>

summary: ISSO F-1 Post-Completion Optional Practical Training (OPT) Workshop
locationaddress: Online Event
description: <p>In this ISSO sponsored session, an ISSO advisor will discuss eligibility requirements and application procedures for F-1 Optional Practical Training (OPT) employment authorization after your graduation. OPT is a benefit and extension of F-1 student status that allows you to work in your field of study for up to 12 months and is authorized by USCIS, the immigration agency. Learn more about Post-Completion OPT -- <a href="http://bit.ly/optemployment" target="_blank">http://bit.ly/optemployment</a>.</p>\n<p>&nbsp;</p>\n<p><a href="https://columbiauniversity.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_DWtR5vD_QrOwGQcHeexwcA" target="_blank">RSVP HERE</a></p>

summary: Melanie Murcott Lecture- Sabin Center for Climate Change Law
locationaddress: Columbia Law School, 435 W. 116 St., New York, NY 10027
description: <p>On <strong>Tuesday, September 20 at 12:10 pm in Room 101</strong>, the Sabin Center is hosting a talk by Melanie&nbsp;Murcott, Associate Professor, Department of Public Law, University of Pretoria, South Africa. The topic is&nbsp;<em>Indigenous communities, power, and justice: Climate litigation sustaining South Africa&rsquo;s Wild Coast.&nbsp;</em></p>\n<p><em>&nbsp;</em><strong>Pizza will be served</strong>.</p>\n<p>Summary:&nbsp;&nbsp;The Eastern Cape High Court, South Africa has, in December 2021 and September 2022, handed down two landmark decisions in climate litigation aimed at blocking a new Shell fossil fuel development off South Africa&rsquo;s Wild Coast. The climate litigation, led by indigenous communities as part of a broader movement for social, environmental, and climate justice, has been heralded as &ldquo;a victory against capitalist extraction and destruction of humanity&rsquo;s common future&hellip;[and] for the whole planet&rdquo;. This presentation describes and evaluates the two decisions, applying a legal theory of transformative environmental constitutionalism. The theory draws on key aspects of South Africa&rsquo;s transformative constitutional regime and the phenomenon of environmental constitutionalism, which indicates that the environment is a proper subject of protection in constitutional texts and by courts.&nbsp;The presentation reveals the power of rights-based strategies in pursuit of climate justice.</p>

summary: The Greener Gender: Women Politicians and Deforestation
locationaddress: International Affairs Building, 420 W. 118 St., New York, NY 10027
categories: Morningside,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Conference,Lecture,Student,Faculty,Staff,Public,Alumni,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Social Sciences,Panel,Social Justice,org/universitylife,org/ilas,org/sipa,Research,Postdocs,Global Programs,Discussion,Graduate Students,Humanities,Political Science,Other
description: <p><strong>Kathryn Baragwanath</strong>&nbsp;is a Research Fellow at the Institute for Humanities and Social Sciences at the Australian Catholic University, based in Melbourne. She received her PhD in political science from the University of California, San Diego in 2021. Her research focuses on the political economy of natural resources and environmental politics, with a focus on Latin America. She is originally from Chile, where she received her BA and Ms in Economics at PUC-Chile and worked as an anti-trust economist at the Fiscalia Nacional Economica before embarking on her PhD at UCSD. &nbsp;</p>\n<p><strong>Paper Abstract: </strong>Women have been shown to have different policy preferences, invest in different types of goods and be less corrupt than men when elected into political office. In this paper, we study the effects of electing a woman mayor into office in Brazil on rates of deforestation, the main source of carbon emissions in Brazil. We exploit a close election regression discontinuity design in order to establish causal findings. We find that electing a woman mayor leads to significantly lower deforestation rates during the woman&#39;s time in office. We propose that women&#39;s effect on reduced deforestation comes through two mechanisms: (i) women&#39;s distinct preferences towards climate change and (ii) a lower likelihood of being captured or corrupt. Although we can&#39;t fully differentiate between the mechanisms, we provide evidence that the capture mechanism is certainly at play. Women mayors are less corrupt than their male counterparts, receive less campaign funding, and are less likely to receive funding or have ties to the agricultural and mining sectors. Additionally, we study how women&#39;s actions lead to lower deforestation rates by looking at whether women mayors impose more environmental fines and embargoes (a sign of better monitoring and enforcement), whether they are also able to reduce the number of fires in their municipalities, and whether there are fewer instances of land related conflict inside their municipalities. Altogether, our findings strongly support the theory that women&#39;s representation reduces deforestation rates in the Brazilian Amazon, with evidence that lower likelihood of regulatory capture and corruption levels are driving these results, at least in part.</p>

description: <p>Nursing has fast become a great career path based on the patient advocacy, clinical acumen and research options. &nbsp;In our joint sessions, we partner with the nursing schools from the University of Pennsylvania and Johns Hopkins University to discuss nursing on a broader scale and how our programs address the various pathways to and through the field. By attending this session, you will not only participate in the discussion, but have the opportunity to gain a better understanding of program options and have your questions answered.</p>\n<p>Please register via the link below:</p>\n<p><a href="https://admissions.nursing.columbia.edu/register/?id=dab3b856-bd53-4e29-ab08-7a6857c64983" target="_blank">Register Here!</a></p>

summary: Yoga Class
locationaddress: Earl Hall, 2980 Broadway, New York, NY 10027
description: <p>Take a break to relax and refresh with yoga in Earl Hall. Free Yoga classes (open level) will be offered in the Auditorium in Earl Hall every&nbsp;Thursday evening&nbsp;during the fall 2022 semester.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>No pre-registration required;&nbsp;open to all Columbia University students. Please bring your own mat and arrive 5-10 minutes early to sign in and set up.&nbsp;There is a 5 minute late policy, doors close at 7:05pm.</p>

summary: SIT Study Abroad Info Session
locationaddress: Kent Hall, 1140 Amsterdam Ave., New York, NY 10027
categories: Morningside,Type,Location,Audience,Category,Information Session,Student,Events open to,org/UniversityEvents,Columbia College,Columbia Engineering,First-years,Sophomores,Juniors,Seniors,First-Generation Students,Transfer Students,Global Core,Global Programs,General Studies,org/gs,org/OGPF,LGBTQ,Study Abroad,Barnard College
description: Join UGE and program representatives from SIT Study Abroad as we discuss their wide variety of program opportunities! SIT is not your ordinary study abroad experience. Participate in an academically rigorous, immersive, and field-based study abroad program in Africa, Asia and the Pacific, Europe, Latin America, and the Middle East. Focus on critical global issues or a field of study that will help you discover your academic pursuits, career aspirations, and personal goals. \nJoin us to learn more!

summary: Music Monday at The Forum
locationaddress: The Forum at Columbia University, 601 W. 125th St., New York, NY 10027
description: <p><em>Music Monday</em>&nbsp;is a free and open-to-the public monthly concert series hosted by The Forum. The concerts will take place in The Forum&#39;s ground-floor Atrium on Monday evenings, once a month. RSVP is encouraged. Please visit The Forum&#39;s website for the full <a href="https://theforum.columbia.edu/events" target="_blank">calendar of events</a>.&nbsp;</p>\n<p>The inaugural September event will feature players from the vibrant and forward-looking&nbsp;<a href="https://mpp.music.columbia.edu/louis-armstrong-jazz-performance-program" target="_blank">Louis Armstrong Jazz Performance Program</a>. This on-campus program brings together the many talented and creative jazz players at Columbia University, providing lessons and ensemble practice that&nbsp;incorporate a wide array of stylistic and rhythmic designs. Columbia&#39;s strength is its interdisciplinary approach to jazz studies, and the LAJPP is a central part of a larger mission which sees jazz as a music without borders and a mode for integrating scholarly inquiry with innovative teaching and community dialogue.</p>
